titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Wallace F. Worthley papers FA795
titlestmt.author: Amy R. Fitch

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-20 01:29:48 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: During the course of his employment with the Rockefeller family, Mr. Worthley wrote lengthy letters to his family in Illinois, describing the Rockefeller boys' and his daily activities as well as the general environment in which he worked and lived for three summers.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: Wallace F. Worthley was a University of Chicago student who was hired by John D. Rockefeller Jr. to be a summer tutor and companion for his four oldest sons: John 3rd, Nelson, Laurance, and Winthrop. Mr. Worthley worked with the family over the course of three summers at their homes in Pocantico Hills, New York, and Bar Harbor, Maine.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters from Mr. Worthley to his family regarding during his employment as a tutor with the Rockefeller family. Letters from the Rockefeller boys to Mr. Worthley.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters to Mr. Worthley regarding his potential employment as a tutor with the Rockefeller family. Letters from Mr. Worthley regarding details of his employment. Letters from the Rockefeller boys and John D. Rockefeller Jr. to Mr. Worthley.
